page.title: 11CHEDDON FITZPAINE CHURCH
page.content: The church of St Mary the virgin is believed to have been originally built in the late 1200's when the land was owned by the Fitz-Payns.The church was restored in 1861.The pulpit and font, with its bowl made of stone from Ham Hill,are believed to date from Henry VIII's time.The oldest gravestone is from 1798.A plaque on the wall behind the gate says "To the Glory of God,in Memory of those of this parish who died in the great war,1914-1918." Funeral services cost Â£18, marriage services Â£23 and a monument Â£38.There is no fee for baptisms. Cheddon has joined with the parishes of Broomfield and Kingston St.Mary.So the early family service will be held at one church,Communion at another and Evensong at the third.The services are rotated each week.There are also mid- week services and classes.
